title: DC-Motor Velocity Control Problem
description: The project focused on designing a controller to drive a DC motor rotor at a specified steady-state angular velocity. The goal was to reject disturbances and attenuate noise using an H-infinity control design approach, implemented and tested through MATLAB and Simulink simulations.

details.challenge: Designing a robust controller capable of minimizing the H-infinity norm to achieve disturbance rejection, noise attenuation, and precise velocity tracking for a DC motor system.
details.solution: Implemented an H-infinity control strategy in MATLAB and Simulink to synthesize a controller that balances robustness and performance under noisy conditions and external disturbances.
